dreisoft.tresos.autosar2.api.model.importer

Class ImporterConstants

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.autosar2.api.model.importer.ImporterConstants

  • public class ImporterConstants
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines constants for importing/exporting configuration via the RCtxt class .

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    11

      Set this option to VAL_INSTANCE_SUFFIX_TRUE to generate instance unique node names for nodes that represent signals and PDUS in the ECU configuration.

      With this option the SHORT-NAME of the Autosar package into which system model information is imported for DBC, LDF and FIBEX formats.

      This option allows to provide a prefix string with which names of nodes imported into the ECU configuration are created.

      Name of the project to import into.

      Path to the System entity to import.

      Validate imported system description arxml against its XML schema file.

      If OPTION_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT is set to this value no Can buffer assignment is created.
      static java.lang.String VAL_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT_TRUE
      If OPTION_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT is set to this value a simple Can buffer assignment is created.
      static java.lang.String VAL_INSTANCE_SUFFIX_FALSE
      If OPTION_INSTANCE_HANDLING is set to this value no instance suffix is added to configuration parameters like signals and pdu.
      static java.lang.String VAL_INSTANCE_SUFFIX_TRUE
      If OPTION_INSTANCE_HANDLING is set to this value an instance suffix is added to configuration parameters like signals and pdu if the ECU configuration stores multiple instances of one system element.
      static java.lang.String VAL_VALIDATE_FALSE
      If OPTION_VALIDATE a system description file is not validated against its schema
      static java.lang.String VAL_VALIDATE_TRUE
      If OPTION_VALIDATE a system description file is validated against its schema

      • OPTION_PROJECT

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_PROJECT
        Name of the project to import into. This option is needed for import of ECU Configuration so that the parser can determine the module configuration into which to import the data.

        11

      • OPTION_ECU_INSTANCE

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT
        Set this option to VAL_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT_TRUE to create a simple buffer assignment for the Can configuration. This option can be used when importing ECU configuration to the Can and CanIf module. If set to VAL_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT_TRUE a simple configuration for HRHs (hardware receive handles) and HTHs (hardware transmit handles) is created.
        Since:
        11
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VAL_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT_TRUE

        public static final java.lang.String VAL_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT_TRUE
        If OPTION_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT is set to this value a simple Can buffer assignment is created.
        Since:
        11
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VAL_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT_FALSE

        public static final java.lang.String VAL_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT_FALSE
        If OPTION_BUFFER_ASSIGNMENT is set to this value no Can buffer assignment is created.
        Since:
        11
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_INSTANCE_HANDLING

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_INSTANCE_HANDLING
        Set this option to VAL_INSTANCE_SUFFIX_TRUE to generate instance unique node names for nodes that represent signals and PDUS in the ECU configuration. Setting this option is not needed for CAN and LIN networks but is most likely needed for FlexRay networks where a PDU or signal can occur multiple times within a frame or a frame can be sent multiple times in different slots.
        Since:
        11
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VAL_INSTANCE_SUFFIX_TRUE

        public static final java.lang.String VAL_INSTANCE_SUFFIX_TRUE
        If OPTION_INSTANCE_HANDLING is set to this value an instance suffix is added to configuration parameters like signals and pdu if the ECU configuration stores multiple instances of one system element.
        Since:
        11
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VAL_INSTANCE_SUFFIX_FALSE

        public static final java.lang.String VAL_INSTANCE_SUFFIX_FALSE
        If OPTION_INSTANCE_HANDLING is set to this value no instance suffix is added to configuration parameters like signals and pdu.
        Since:
        11
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_PACKAGE_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_PACKAGE_NAME
        With this option the SHORT-NAME of the Autosar package into which system model information is imported for DBC, LDF and FIBEX formats.
        Since:
        11
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_PREFIX

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_PREFIX
        This option allows to provide a prefix string with which names of nodes imported into the ECU configuration are created.
        Since:
        11
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_EXPORT_PATHS

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_EXPORT_PATHS
        This option allows to specify paths (comma separated), to which the output shall be restricted when you save (see RCtxt.save(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus)) an RCtxt to a "sysd" content type Location.

        If this option is combined with OPTION_EXPORT_TYPES, only those types will be exported which are contained in one of the specified paths (in this case it is e.g. possible that a specified path is not exported at all).

        Note that you can also refer to types using a path (e.g. ASTyped:CanFrameTriggering). The difference to the OPTION_EXPORT_TYPES is, that in this way the defined types will not be restricted by the defined paths (since they are handled like a path too).

        Note that an empty String has the meaning that nothing shall be exported!
        Since:
        15.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_EXPORT_TYPES

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_EXPORT_TYPES
        This option allows to specify type names (camel-case, comma separated), to which the output shall be restricted when you save (see RCtxt.save(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus)) an RCtxt to a "sysd" content type Location.
        Note that you can also define types using OPTION_EXPORT_PATHS with a slightly different behavior - see there for details.

        Note that an empty String has the meaning that nothing shall be exported!
        Since:
        15.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • OPTION_MODULE

        public static java.lang.String OPTION_MODULE(java.lang.String moduleType)
        This method creates the option name of an option that stores the name of an ECU configuration module configuration of a module configuration into which system information should be imported.
        Parameters:
        moduleType - The type of the module (Can, CanIf, PduR, Com...)
        Returns:
        The option name config_moduleType
        Since:
        11
